news.title: Chinese developer Shimao Group defaults on trust loan
news.para: China Credit Trust Co said in the letter, confirmed by two sources familiar with the matter, that 755 million yuan of the trust loan had been repaid. However, the absence of the remaining payment meant the loan was now in default, it added in the letter to investors in the loan.

news.title: China: Guangzhou R&F Properties says short of funds to settle bond tender offer
news.para: Guangzhou R&F Properties said in a filing late on Wednesday that the funds available to settle its tender offer for the offshore bond was materially less than the $300 million it previously expected, due to continued volatility in the property sector.

news.title: MoEFCC calls for legal action in Corbett illegal construction case
news.para: The communication, issued by Charan Jeet Singh, senior official of MoEFCC, says that legal proceedings should be initiated against offenders under section 3A and 3B of the Forest Conservation Act of 1980. A copy of the order is available with TOI.

news.title: Draft of masterplan-2031 for Varanasi prepared on GIS platform
news.para: “Both these masterplans were tabled before the VDA board in a meeting on December 28,” said Duhan, adding that the VDA board gave its approval to the draft and base map on GIS platform.

news.title: Kolhapur civic body clears almost 1,468 building proposals
news.para: The town planning department of the Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC) has received 1,468 building proposals, of which, many have been cleared. The remaining are in the final stages of clearances.

news.title: Manesar: 10-acre of illegal plotted colony razed again
news.para: The department had carried out demolition in the area in July last year. Gurgaon police had also filed an FIR against the offenders. But theywere still carrying out construction work in violation of the norms.

news.title: Morbi ceramic industry cracking under rising costs
news.para: “Around 100 more units are on the verge of closing down by the end of this month due to rise in input cost,” said Mukesh Ughareja, former president of Morbi Ceramic Association.

news.title: Karnataka: Property revenue exceeds target in 2021 amid pandemic pressure
news.para: ​The department of stamps and registration, the third-highest revenue grosser for the state, has already met over 76 per cent of its revenue target for the financial year 2021-2022, which is also indicative of a booming realty sector.

news.title: Nagpur: Tax unpaid, 3.8 lakh property owners lose rebate, face interest
news.para: In the first nine months of this financial year, the cash-strapped civic body has managed to collect only 150 crore as property tax out of total demand of 650 crore, including 250 crore of current fiscal and remaining Rs400 crore is arrears of previous financial years.

news.title: CCI slaps Rs 20 lakh fine on Investcorp India Asset Managers
news.para: The transaction was on a slump sale basis for a lump sum consideration and got completed in February 2019. For the transaction, Investcorp India was required to give a notice to the fair trade regulator.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh RERA revives Noida project stuck for four years
news.para: Rajesh Kumar Tyagi, secretary, UP-Rera, in his order issued on January 4, allowed the transfer of a plot covering 20,000 square metres (five acres) that belonged to Proplarity Infratech Pvt Ltd to Urbanac Building Technologies.

news.title: Maharashtra REAT to rehear cases as retired member can't sign order
news.para: The RERA appellate tribunal recently directed rehearing of two appeals as one of the members retired before the final reasoned judgment could be passed, though an operative part of the order was pronounced on July 26.

news.title: Brookfield leads race to acquire IL&FS 4.5-lakh sq ft headquarter in Mumbai
news.para: IL&FS board has put the group's corporate headquarters on the block as part of the resolution process to address Rs 99,000 crore of debt.

news.title: DCB Bank buys 15,464 sq ft office space in Mumbai's Lower Parel
news.para: The bank has acquired the office space on 18th floor of tower A of the commercial project. Along with the carpet area of over 10,049 sq ft, the bank will also get exclusive access to 15 car parks as part of this deal.

news.title: As pressure mounts, China Evergrande seeks delaying onshore bond payment
news.para: Evergrande is struggling to repay more than $300 billion in liabilities, including nearly $20 billion of offshore bonds deemed in cross-default by ratings agencies last month after it missed payments.
